data.name: Digital Alchemist & Grandmagus
data.title: Software Engineer & Founder (Go, JavaScript, C, HTMX, PostgreSQL, TailwindCSS)
content: We meticulously sculpt {{bespoke software}} and conjure {{hardware wonders}}, transcending the mundane.
In the digital symphony, our craft includes {{exotic spells and scrolls}}, weaving enchantment into the very fabric of technology.

data.name: TypeScript Wizard
data.title: Full-stack TypeScript developer (React, React Native, Node.js, PostgreSQL, GraphQL, TypeORM, TailwindCSS)
content: Part of a {{fast-paced team}} as a full-stack engineer on a huge monorepo comprising of a {{React-based SPA}} serving both internal users and customers, {{React Native app}} for couriers and a layer-based monolithic {{Node.js backend}} using a {{PostgreSQL}} database.

I worked {{directly}} with the product department as well as with Shippr's operative department in order to {{solve}} both our customers' and partner-couriers' {{problems}} as well as our internal operatives teams' problems on a {{daily basis}}.

data.name: Code Magus & Guildmaster
data.title: Full-stack TypeScript developer (React, Node.js, MongoDB, GraphQL, AWS)
content: Designing, managing, developing and maintaining handcrafted {{SaaS}}, websites, {{applications}} and other web-based solutions. Our main target were small to medium businesses, physical or digital with some exclusive software aimed at {{Shopify}} merchants.

data.name: TypeScript & Shopify Mechanist
data.title: Full-stack TypeScript developer & Shopify technician (React, Node.js, Shopify API)
content: Member of a 4 (wo)men team working on an e-commerce website using {{Shopify}}, I was the technical side of it and wore multiple hats such as : CMS technician, {{front-end developer}} (HTML, CSS, Liquid, JavaScript) and {{Shopify app developer}} (Node.js & React/Polaris).
Part of my work consisted of giving {{technical analysis}} as well as assistance when my teammates had trouble with the CMS, hosting, mailing, etc.

The other part consisted of developing {{frontend-oriented content}} using Node.js (TypeScript), JavaScript, HTML, CSS and Liquid to better the website's {{UX}}, add functionalities or simply modify the existing theme or third-party applications' integrations.
Most of the work was done {{remotely}} with occasional in-person meeting with the other members of the team.

data.name: C#/.Net Sorcerer
data.title: Full-stack C#/.Net developer (C#, .Net, JavaScript)
content: Working in a 2 men team, I participated to the building of a full {{e-commerce website}} for a major business in Li√®ge, Belgium.
Based on a proprietary framework, itself built on top of the {{.Net}} framework (no CMS). The tools I used were: C#, .Net, JavaScript, HTML, CSS.
I had to learn C# and .Net in 2 weeks before the interview, my heavy background in C++ was a good help during the {{learning}} phase and my everyday work.
My main mission was to work on {{UI/UX}} and connect the backend and frontend while developing new components on the frontend.

data.name: C++/C# Gamesmith
data.title: Game developer (C++, C#, Unity)
content: My main area of action was : establishing a {{technical scope statement}} & creating a program (video games, servers, developing tools) working directly with the game designer to apply his ideas, see what is possible, what is not & what can be modified in an {{UX perspective}}.
Based on a game design document (GDD), with no technical terms or directives, I had to :
- {{Design}} & {{develop}} the program's architecture
- Define {{priorities}} in the program's development
- {{Prototype}} & create a {{MVP}} (Minimum Viable Product)
- Actively participate in {{UI design}}
- Actively participate in {{UX design}}

I have mainly worked on 3 projects with the game designer, one inside a bigger team. Except for the first game, I was {{fully in charge}} over the entire technical development. In the first one I was only on the client side (Game mechanics development, UI & UX design), the server side being worked on by another programmer.

data.name: C++ Mage & Hardware Enchanter
data.title: C++ embedded developer (C++, Arduino, C#, Unity)
content: Working along with a 3D Designer/Modeler I had to develop several {{interactive}} programs, on a {{fast-prototyping}} basis.
One of them was an {{architectural visualization}} of our working place, called Archiviz.
Another one was a smartphone {{VR experience}} prototype that had to include some mechanics such as a grab & drop system.
The last project I worked on was a Game Design/UX {{experiment}} where I had to {{hack}} an indoor bike to a USB controller, then I had to make a simple procedurally generated roller coaster.
The user had then to pedal to make their character move along the roller coaster.
What was expected of me here was to {{quickly}} develop {{proofs of concepts}}, work along with the artist and modify the program's design {{on-the-go}}. Only keeping the bare essential.

data.name: Tutorial NPC
data.title: Helpdesk operator
content: After receiving training on the company's tools and processes I had to take customer's calls and {{solve their problems}}.
What was expected from me was to follow "as-is" procedures from head to tail even if I knew the solution to the customer's problem.
I wasn't following standard procedures and used my {{knowledge in computer science}} and general networking to solve the customer's problem faster.
I had the {{opportunity}} to use the company "expert" tools even though I wasn't trained to do so. I {{studied those aside}} of my working time, in order to be more effective in my position.

data.name: Binary Squire
data.title: Student & Open Source contributor
content: I contributed on several {{Open Source}} projects during three years, being in {{code}} writing & revision or in {{design}} discussion with more experienced developers. This is where I started {{programming}} and where I learned the most.
Some of the projects I have contributed to :
- Egloo platform (cultural initiative from France)
- Pinguino {{prototyping}} platform
- {{Hackerspace}} Global Grid
